ACUTELY.Definition: feeling or noticing something very strongly

DESCENDED.Definition: come from, to be related to

YIDDISH.Definition: a language related to German that is spoken by some Jewish people, especially in Eastern Europe

BUFF.Definition: someone who knows a lot about something and is interested in it

THEORISED.Definition: thought that something could be explained by something else

PLAGUED.Definition: cause pain and suffering to (for a long time)

MELTING POT.Definition: a place with many different people, cultures, religions and ideas

PSEUDONYM.Definition: a name used instead of a real name

TONES.Definition: different ways of pronouncing the same syllable

GET BY.Definition: manage, be able to deal with a situation

BANNED.Definition: forbidden, not allowed to be used

ROUNDED UP.Definition: found and forced to go to prison or jail

PRECURSOR.Definition: something that happened before something else

PLOT.Definition: a secret plan by a group of people

LINGUISTIC.Definition: relating to language or the study of language

INTELLECTUAL.Definition: relating to a desire to understand things

FELLOW.Definition: someone with the same interests or job as you

NETWORK EFFECTS.Definition: a situation when anyone who does the same thing adds value to the entire community

NICHE.Definition: something enjoyed by a small amount of people

HOBBYIST.Definition: something that people do in their free time

LENDS ITSELF.Definition: is naturally a good fit for

ADVOCATES.Definition: someone who publicly supports an idea

NOBLE.Definition: good in an honest and brave sense
